brief_summary.textblock:
This is a pilot study to determine the optimum time and dose to draw blood samples using a
      tracer for HDL kinetics.

clinical_study.brief_title: Dose of Labeled Cholesterol for Kinetics: A Pilot Study

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

        • Healthy men and women ages 18 - 50

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Cardiovascular disease

          -  Metabolic disease

          -  Hematologic disorder

          -  Liver or kidney disease

          -  phenylketonuria

          -  Currently taking lipid lowering medications or any other drugs that could affect
             lipid metabolism

clinical_study.official_title: Dose of Labeled Cholesterol and Phenylalanine for HDL Kinetics: A Pilot Study

primary_outcome.description: 13C3 cholesterol, which is labeled with a stable isotope, will be administered orally. Blood samples will be taken every 4-6 hours for 72 hours for the measurement of stable isotopic enrichment in cholesterol using gas chromatography-mass spectrometry. The study has a dual purpose: to determine the optimum oral dose of isotope, and to determine the time of peak enrichment in plasma cholesterol.
primary_outcome.measure: Incorporation of orally administered 13C3 cholesterol into plasma cholesterol

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Pharmacokinetics Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Basic Science
